questiontext.text:
A spinner has the probability distribution shown below.

xx Pr(x)\text{Pr}(x)
8 0.19
13 0.18
19 0.5
28 0.13
  1. What is the probability of spinning 8? In other words, what is Pr(X=8)\text{Pr}(X=8)? {1:NUMERICAL:=0.19:0.01}
  2. What is the probability of spinning 19 or 28? In other words, what is Pr(X=19 or X=28)\text{Pr}(X=19 ~\text{ or }~ X=28)? {1:NUMERICAL:=0.63:0.01}
  3. If spinning twice, what is the probability of first spinning 19 and then spinning 28? In other words, what is Pr(X1=19 and X2=28)\text{Pr}(X_1=19 ~\text{ and }~ X_2=28)? {1:NUMERICAL:=0.065:0.01}
  4. What is the probability of spinning at least 13? In other words, what is Pr(X≥13)\text{Pr}(X\ge 13)? {1:NUMERICAL:=0.81:0.01}
  5. Determine the mean of the probability distribution by using μ=∑x⋅Pr(x)\mu = \sum x\cdot \text{Pr}(x). {1:NUMERICAL:=17:0.01}
  6. Determine the standard deviation of the probability distribution by using σ=∑(x−μ)2⋅Pr(x)\sigma = \sqrt{\sum (x-\mu)^2 \cdot \text{Pr}(x)}. {1:NUMERICAL:=6:0.01}

generalfeedback.text:
Make a table (for parts mean and standard deviation).

xx Pr(x)\text{Pr}(x) x⋅Pr(x)x\cdot\text{Pr}(x) x−μx-\mu (x−μ)2(x-\mu)^2 (x−μ)2⋅Pr(x)(x-\mu)^2 \cdot \text{Pr}(x)
8 0.19 1.52 -9 81 15.39
13 0.18 2.34 -4 16 2.88
19 0.5 9.5 2 4 2
28 0.13 3.64 11 121 15.73
========= ========= ========= ========= ========= =========
∑x⋅Pr(x)=17\sum x \cdot \text{Pr}(x) = 17 σ2=36\sigma^2 = 36
μ=17\mu = 17 σ=6\sigma = 6
  1. 0.19
  2. 0.5+0.130.5 + 0.13 = 0.63
  3. 0.5×0.130.5 \times 0.13 = 0.065
  4. 0.81
  5. μ=17\mu = 17
  6. σ=6\sigma = 6

questiontext.text:
A spinner has the probability distribution shown below.

xx Pr(x)\text{Pr}(x)
3 0.19
11 0.11
14 0.36
27 0.34
  1. What is the probability of spinning 27? In other words, what is Pr(X=27)\text{Pr}(X=27)? {1:NUMERICAL:=0.34:0.01}
  2. What is the probability of spinning 3 or 14? In other words, what is Pr(X=3 or X=14)\text{Pr}(X=3 ~\text{ or }~ X=14)? {1:NUMERICAL:=0.55:0.01}
  3. If spinning twice, what is the probability of first spinning 3 and then spinning 14? In other words, what is Pr(X1=3 and X2=14)\text{Pr}(X_1=3 ~\text{ and }~ X_2=14)? {1:NUMERICAL:=0.0684:0.01}
  4. What is the probability of spinning at least 14? In other words, what is Pr(X≥14)\text{Pr}(X\ge 14)? {1:NUMERICAL:=0.7:0.01}
  5. Determine the mean of the probability distribution by using μ=∑x⋅Pr(x)\mu = \sum x\cdot \text{Pr}(x). {1:NUMERICAL:=16:0.01}
  6. Determine the standard deviation of the probability distribution by using σ=∑(x−μ)2⋅Pr(x)\sigma = \sqrt{\sum (x-\mu)^2 \cdot \text{Pr}(x)}. {1:NUMERICAL:=8.8:0.01}

generalfeedback.text:
Make a table (for parts mean and standard deviation).

xx Pr(x)\text{Pr}(x) x⋅Pr(x)x\cdot\text{Pr}(x) x−μx-\mu (x−μ)2(x-\mu)^2 (x−μ)2⋅Pr(x)(x-\mu)^2 \cdot \text{Pr}(x)
3 0.19 0.57 -13 169 32.11
11 0.11 1.21 -5 25 2.75
14 0.36 5.04 -2 4 1.44
27 0.34 9.18 11 121 41.14
========= ========= ========= ========= ========= =========
∑x⋅Pr(x)=16\sum x \cdot \text{Pr}(x) = 16 σ2=77.44\sigma^2 = 77.44
μ=16\mu = 16 σ=8.8\sigma = 8.8
  1. 0.34
  2. 0.19+0.360.19 + 0.36 = 0.55
  3. 0.19×0.360.19 \times 0.36 = 0.0684
  4. 0.7
  5. μ=16\mu = 16
  6. σ=8.8\sigma = 8.8
